bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 114 (Tuesday, July 9, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. PORTER:H.R. 3643.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8[Page H5304]

item.title: Accountability for Wall Street Executives Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text:
Accountability for Wall Street Executives Act

This bill allows state attorneys general, with reasonable cause, to issue subpoenas to investigate national banks for state law compliance. State attorneys general may also collect aggregate data on financial services provided in the state by national banks.

bill.title: Accountability for Wall Street Executives Act

item.title: Accountability for Wall Street Executives Act

To amend the Revised Statutes to grant State attorneys general the ability to issue subpoenas to investigate suspected violations of State laws that are applicable to national banks, and for other purposes.
Accountability for Wall Street Executives Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
